input: How is a single HVACTemplate:Zone:Unitary object typically used?
output: Often a single HVACTemplate:Zone:Unitary object will be used with a single HVACTemplate:System:Unitary (or HVACTemplate:System:UnitaryHeatPump:AirToAir or HVACTemplate:System:UnitarySystem) object to simulate single zone direct-expansion based air conditioning systems.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Can multiple HVACTemplate:Zone:Unitary objects reference the same system object?
output: Yes multiple HVACTemplate:Zone:Unitary objects may appear that all reference the same HVACTemplate:System object in a multiple zone version.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: In a multizone system how many zones are specified as the control zone?
output: For a multizone system only one zone is specified as the control zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are examples of direct expansion systems?
output: Direct expansion includes single packaged rooftop systems commonly seen in commercial applications and split systems commonly seen in residential applications.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the 'Field: Zone Name'?
output: Enter the name of the zone. The name must match a building zone name used in the ZONE object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the 'Field: Template Unitary System Name'?
output: Enter the name of the HVACTemplate:System:Unitary HVACTemplate:System:UnitaryHeatPump:AirToAir or HVACTemplate:System:UnitarySystem object serving this zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the 'Field: Template Thermostat Name'?
output: Enter the name of a HVACTemplate:Thermostat object. Multiple HVACTemplate:Zone:* objects can reference the same HVACTemplate:Thermostat object which makes it easier to revise the thermostat controls for portions of a building.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a blank entry in the 'Field: Template Thermostat Name' mean?
output: A blank entry means that traditional thermostat objects referencing the same zone name are used instead of HVACTemplate:Thermostat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if 'Autosize' is entered in the 'Field: Supply Air Maximum Flow Rate'?
output: By entering Autosize the maximum supply air flow rate is automatically determined for the zone based on the loads experienced by the zone during the specified heating and cooling SizingPeriod:DesignDay.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is required for autosizing the flow rate in a zone?
output: The zone must have a thermostat specified in order to autosize the flow rate even if it is not the control zone in a multiple zone unitary system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What units are used for the 'Field: Supply Air Maximum Flow Rate'?
output: The units are in m3/s.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Zone Heating Sizing Factor' input represent?
output: This input is the zone level heating sizing ratio.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What objects can serve the zone in the context of HVAC Template Systems?
output: HVACTemplate:System:Unitary HVACTemplate:System:UnitaryHeatPump:AirToAir or HVACTemplate:System:UnitarySystem objects can serve this zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the 'Template Thermostat Name' field?
output: Enter the name of an HVACTemplate:Thermostat object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Can multiple HVACTemplate:Zone:* objects reference the same HVACTemplate:Thermostat object?
output: Yes multiple HVACTemplate:Zone:* objects can reference the same HVACTemplate:Thermostat object making it easier to revise thermostat controls for portions of a building.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a blank entry in the 'Template Thermostat Name' field signify?
output: A blank entry means that traditional thermostat objects referencing the same zone name are used instead of HVACTemplate:Thermostat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens when 'Autosize' is entered in the 'Supply Air Maximum Flow Rate' field?
output: The maximum supply air flow rate is automatically determined for the zone based on the loads experienced during the specified heating and cooling SizingPeriod:DesignDay.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Is a thermostat required for autosizing the flow rate?
output: Yes the zone must have a thermostat specified to autosize the flow rate even if it is not the control zone in a multiple zone unitary system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the units for the 'Supply Air Maximum Flow Rate'?
output: The units are in m3/s.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Zone Heating Sizing Factor' field specify?
output: This input is the zone level heating sizing ratio. The zone design heating air flow rate and load will be multiplied by the number input in this field when Supply Air Maximum Flow Rate is autosized.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the 'Zone Heating Sizing Factor' field is left blank?
output: If this field is left blank the Heating Sizing Factor from Sizing:Parameters will be used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Zone Cooling Sizing Factor' field specify?
output: This input is the zone level cooling sizing ratio. The zone design cooling air flow rate and load will be multiplied by the number input in this field when Supply Air Maximum Flow Rate is autosized.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the 'Zone Cooling Sizing Factor' field is left blank?
output: If this field is left blank the Cooling Sizing Factor from Sizing:Parameters will be used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the possible inputs for the 'Outdoor Air Method' field?
output: The input must be either Flow/Zone Flow/Person Flow/Area Sum Maximum or DetailedSpecification.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Flow/Zone' option in the 'Outdoor Air Method' field mean?
output: Flow/Zone means that the program will use the input of the field Outdoor Air Flow as the zone design outdoor air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Flow/Person' option in the 'Outdoor Air Method' field mean?
output: Flow/Person means the program will use the input from the field Outdoor Air Flow per Person and the maximum occupancy to calculate a zone design outdoor air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Flow/Area' option in the 'Outdoor Air Method' field mean?
output: Flow/Area means the program will use the input from the field Outdoor Air Flow per Zone Floor Area to calculate a zone design outdoor air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Sum' option in the 'Outdoor Air Method' field mean?
output: Sum means that the flows calculated from the fields Outdoor Air Flow per Person Outdoor Air Flow per Area and Outdoor Air Flow per Zone will be added to obtain the zone design outdoor air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Maximum' option in the 'Outdoor Air Method' field mean?
output: Maximum means that the maximum flow derived from Outdoor Air Flow per Person Outdoor Air Flow per Area and Outdoor Air Flow per Zone will be used for the zone design outdoor air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default option for the 'Outdoor Air Method' field?
output: The default is Flow/Person.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'DetailedSpecification' option in the 'Outdoor Air Method' field mean?
output: DetailedSpecification means that the outdoor air specifications will be taken from a DesignSpecification:OutdoorAir object and optional DesignSpecification:ZoneAirDistribution object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the Supply Air Maximum Flow Rate field is left blank?
output: If this field is left blank the Heating Sizing Factor from Sizing:Parameters will be used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the Zone Cooling Sizing Factor field?
output: This input is the zone level cooling sizing ratio. The zone design cooling air flow rate and load will be multiplied by the number input in this field when Supply Air Maximum Flow Rate is autosized.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the Zone Cooling Sizing Factor field is left blank?
output: If this field is left blank the Cooling Sizing Factor from Sizing:Parameters will be used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the possible inputs for the Outdoor Air Method field?
output: The input must be either Flow/Zone or Flow/Person Flow/Area Sum Maximum or DetailedSpecification.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Flow/Zone option mean for the Outdoor Air Method?
output: Flow/Zone means that the program will use the input of the field Outdoor Air Flow as the zone design outdoor air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Flow/Person option mean for the Outdoor Air Method?
output: Flow/Person means the program will use the input from the field Outdoor Air Flow per Person and the maximum occupancy to calculate a zone design outdoor air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Flow/Area option mean for the Outdoor Air Method?
output: Flow/Area means the program will use the input from the field Outdoor Air Flow per Zone Floor Area to calculate a zone design outdoor air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Sum option mean for the Outdoor Air Method?
output: Sum means that the flows calculated from the fields Outdoor Air Flow per Person Outdoor Air Flow per Area and Outdoor Air Flow per Zone will be added to obtain the zone design outdoor air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Maximum option mean for the Outdoor Air Method?
output: Maximum means that the maximum flow derived from Outdoor Air Flow per Person Outdoor Air Flow per Area and Outdoor Air Flow per Zone will be used for the zone design outdoor air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default option for the Outdoor Air Method?
output: The default is Flow/Person.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the DetailedSpecification option mean for the Outdoor Air Method?
output: DetailedSpecification means that the outdoor air specifications will be taken from a DesignSpecification:OutdoorAir object and optional DesignSpecification:ZoneAirDistribution object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the total outdoor air flow for the system calculated if the air handler serves more than one zone?
output: The total outdoor air flow for the system is the sum of the zone outdoor air flows if the system outdoor air flow is autosized.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the amount of outdoor air delivered to a zone determined when multiple zones share a single outdoor air source?
output: The amount of outdoor air actually delivered to the zone is based on the fraction of supply air delivered to the zone to the total supply air from the system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the design outdoor air flow rate per person for a zone?
output: The design outdoor air flow rate per person for this zone is in cubic meters per second. The default is 0.00944 (20 cfm per person).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the outdoor air flow rate calculated based on the number of people?
output: An outdoor air flow rate is calculated based on the total number of people for all People statements assigned to the zone. Occupancy schedule values are not applied.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the outdoor air flow rate per person used?
output: This input is used if Outdoor Air Method is one of Outdoor Air Flow per Person Sum or Maximum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the design outdoor air volumetric flow rate per square meter of floor area?
output: The design outdoor air volumetric flow rate per square meter of floor area is in units of m³/s-m².

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the outdoor air flow rate calculated using the zone floor area?
output: This input is multiplied by the zone area to obtain a flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the outdoor air flow rate per zone floor area used?
output: This input is used if Outdoor Air Method is Flow/Area Sum or Maximum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the design outdoor air flow rate for a zone?
output: The design outdoor air flow rate for this zone is in cubic meters per second.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the outdoor air flow rate per zone used?
output: This input field is used if Outdoor Air Method is Flow/Zone Sum or Maximum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the Supply Plenum Name field?
output: This field allows the user to specify a supply plenum which serves only this zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Where is the plenum zone added in the supply air path?
output: The plenum zone is added to the supply air path after the system splitter or system-level supply plenum and before the zone terminal unit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be done if no supply plenum is specified?
output: Set to blank if no supply plenum is specified.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the Design Specification Outdoor Air Object Name and Design Specification Zone Air Distribution Object Name fields used for?
output: They are referenced in the Design Specification Outdoor Air Object Name and Design Specification Zone Air Distribution Object Name fields below.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the total outdoor air flow for the system determined if the air handler serves more than one zone and the system outdoor air flow is autosized?
output: The total outdoor air flow for the system is the sum of the zone outdoor air flows if the system outdoor air flow is autosized.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the amount of outdoor air delivered to a zone determined when zones share a single outdoor air source?
output: The amount of outdoor air actually delivered to the zone is based on the fraction of supply air delivered to the zone to the total supply air from the system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the design outdoor air flow rate per person for a zone?
output: The design outdoor air flow rate per person for this zone is in cubic meters per second with a default of 0.00944 (20 cfm per person).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the outdoor air flow rate calculated for a zone?
output: An outdoor air flow rate is calculated based on the total number of people for all People statements assigned to the zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Are occupancy schedule values applied when calculating outdoor air flow rate per person?
output: No occupancy schedule values are not applied.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the input for outdoor air flow rate per person used?
output: This input is used if 'Outdoor Air Method' is one of 'Outdoor Air Flow per Person' 'Sum' or 'Maximum'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the design outdoor air volumetric flow rate per square meter of floor area?
output: The design outdoor air volumetric flow rate per square meter of floor area is in units of m³/s-m².

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the flow rate obtained from the outdoor air flow rate per zone floor area?
output: This input is multiplied by the zone area to obtain a flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the input for outdoor air flow rate per zone floor area used?
output: This input is used if 'Outdoor Air Method' is 'Flow/Area Sum' or 'Maximum'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the design outdoor air flow rate for a zone?
output: The design outdoor air flow rate for this zone is in cubic meters per second.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the input for outdoor air flow rate per zone used?
output: This input field is used if 'Outdoor Air Method' is 'Flow/Zone Sum' or 'Maximum'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Supply Plenum Name' field allow the user to specify?
output: This field allows the user to specify a supply plenum which serves only this zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Where is the plenum zone added in the supply air path?
output: The plenum zone is added to the supply air path after the system splitter or system-level supply plenum and before the zone terminal unit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be done if no supply plenum is to be modeled?
output: Set the field to blank if no supply plenum is to be modeled.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How should a modeled supply plenum be specified?
output: If a supply plenum is modeled it must be modeled as a zone with surfaces and the name of the plenum zone should be entered here.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Return Plenum Name' field allow the user to specify?
output: This field allows the user to specify a return plenum which serves only this zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Where is the plenum zone added in the return air path?
output: The plenum zone is added to the return air path immediately after the zone and before the system mixer or system-level return plenum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be done if no zone return plenum is to be modeled?
output: Set the field to blank if no zone return plenum is to be modeled.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How should a modeled zone return plenum be specified?
output: If a zone return plenum is modeled it must be modeled as a zone with surfaces and the name of the plenum zone should be entered here.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Baseboard Heating Type' field specify?
output: This field specifies the availability of thermostatically controlled baseboard heat in this zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices for baseboard heating type?
output: The choices are: HotWater Electric and None.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default choice for baseboard heating type?
output: The default choice is None.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be done if baseboard heating is to be available for the entire year?
output: Leave the 'Baseboard Heating Availability Schedule Name' field blank if you want the baseboard heating to be available for the entire year to perform heating if called for by the thermostat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How should the schedule be specified if a schedule name is used for baseboard heating availability?
output: If a schedule name is specified those times that the baseboard heating is available should be specified as 1.0 and those times that the baseboard heating is not available should have a zero value in the schedule.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the baseboard heating availability schedule specify?
output: It specifies when the baseboard can provide heat not when it is actually providing heat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for baseboard heating capacity if the sizing algorithm is to determine the capacity?
output: Enter 'autosize' to allow the sizing algorithm to determine the proper capacity required based on the loads experienced during the heating design day.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a specified value for baseboard heating capacity represent?
output: It is the maximum amount of heat that the baseboard heating can deliver in Watts.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What will EnergyPlus autosizing do for baseboard heating?
output: EnergyPlus autosizing will autosize the baseboard heating to meet the full heating load of the zone regardless of the heating capability of the baseboard.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be done if no supply plenum is to be modeled?
output: If no supply plenum is to be modeled the field should be left blank.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How should a supply plenum be modeled if it is included?
output: If a supply plenum is modeled it must be modeled as a zone with surfaces and the name of the plenum zone should be entered.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Return Plenum Name' field specify?
output: The 'Return Plenum Name' field allows the user to specify a return plenum which serves only this zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if no zone return plenum is modeled?
output: Set the field to blank if no zone return plenum is to be modeled.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How should a zone return plenum be modeled if it is included?
output: If a zone return plenum is modeled it must be modeled as a zone with surfaces and the name of the plenum zone should be entered.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Baseboard Heating Type' field specify?
output: The 'Baseboard Heating Type' field specifies the availability of thermostatically controlled baseboard heat in the zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices for the 'Baseboard Heating Type' field?
output: The choices are HotWater Electric and None.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default choice for the 'Baseboard Heating Type' field?
output: The default choice is None.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Baseboard Heating Availability Schedule Name' field specify?
output: This field specifies the schedule for when the baseboard heating is available.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be done if the baseboard heating is to be available for the entire year?
output: Leave the 'Baseboard Heating Availability Schedule Name' field blank.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should the schedule values be when the baseboard heating is available or not available?
output: The schedule values should be 1.0 when available and zero when not available.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Baseboard Heating Capacity' field?
output: The 'Baseboard Heating Capacity' field specifies the maximum amount of heat the baseboard heating can deliver or allows autosizing to determine the capacity.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if 'autosize' is entered in the 'Baseboard Heating Capacity' field?
output: If 'autosize' is entered the sizing algorithm determines the proper capacity required based on the loads during the heating design day.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does EnergyPlus autosizing handle baseboard heating?
output: EnergyPlus autosizing will size the baseboard heating to meet the full heating load of the zone regardless of the unitary air handling system's capability.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the heating priority of baseboard heating?
output: The baseboard heating is set to heating priority 2.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What change occurred starting with v7.1 regarding baseboard heating capacity?
output: Starting with v7.1 the capacity is used for both hot water and electric baseboard not just electric.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method' field specify?
output: This field selects the method for specifying the cooling design supply air temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'SupplyAirTemperature' method use for cooling design?
output: The 'SupplyAirTemperature' method uses the Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature for sizing the zone cooling design air flow rate and the cooling coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'TemperatureDifference' method use for cooling design?
output: The 'TemperatureDifference' method uses the Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Difference.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'SystemSupplyAirTemperature' method use for cooling design?
output: The 'SystemSupplyAirTemperature' method uses the Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature from the template unitary system serving the zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default method for the 'Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method' field?
output: The default is 'SystemSupplyAirTemperature.'

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature' field?
output: It specifies the supply air temperature in degrees Celsius for the zone cooling design air flow rate calculation and cooling coil sizing.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the 'Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature' field used?
output: It is used only when the Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method is 'SupplyAirTemperature.'

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

output: It specifies the temperature difference between the cooling design supply air temperature and the zone air temperature in degrees Celsius for the zone cooling design air flow rate calculation and cooling coil sizing.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

output: It is used only when the Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method is 'TemperatureDifference.'

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the heating priority for the baseboard heating in a unitary air handling system?
output: The baseboard heating will be set to heating priority 2 which means it will meet any remaining heating load not met by the unitary system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How has the capacity application for baseboard heating changed starting with version 7.1?
output: Prior to v7.1 the capacity was only applied to electric baseboard. Starting with v7.1 the capacity will be used for both hot water and electric baseboard.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
