output: At full cooling the damper will be fully open.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens to the damper at minimum cooling and for heating?
output: At minimum cooling and for heating the damper will be at the minimum stop and the secondary air flow will be at its maximum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> figure in /UAStudy/EnergyPlus/doc/input-output-reference/media/
input: What does Figure 156 depict?
output: Figure 156 depicts the Series PIU Terminal Unit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the function of the parallel powered induction unit?
output: The parallel powered induction unit is an air system terminal unit that mixes varying amounts of secondary (recirculated) air and primary (conditioned supply) air to produce a variable total flow of air to a zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What components does the parallel powered induction unit contain?
output: The unit contains a small fan that acts to induce the secondary air and a heating coil for heating the mixed secondary and primary air.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When does the fan in the parallel powered induction unit run?
output: The fan runs only when the primary air flow is below the Parallel Fan On Flow Fraction and the fan's availability schedule is on or it is activated by an availability manager.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does the secondary fan operate in the HVACTemplate:Zone:VAV:FanPowered system?
output: The secondary fan will operate according to the Zone PIU Fan Schedule and any Night Cycle Control specified in the system it is served by.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the primary air inlet contain?
output: The primary air inlet contains a damper that can move from fully open (maximum primary air) to a minimum stop (minimum primary air).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens to the primary air damper at full cooling load?
output: At full cooling load the primary air damper is fully open and the fan is off.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens as the cooling load decreases?
output: As the cooling load decreases the primary air damper gradually closes and the secondary air flow remains close to zero.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When does the fan switch on in the parallel powered induction unit?
output: The fan switches on when the primary air flow has reached the minimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When does the heating coil switch on in the parallel powered induction unit?
output: The heating coil will switch on as needed to meet any heating demand.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> figure in /UAStudy/EnergyPlus/doc/input-output-reference/media/
input: What does Figure 157 depict?
output: Figure 157 depicts the Parallel PIU Terminal Unit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the Field: Zone Name?
output: Enter the name of the zone. The name must match a building zone name used in the ZONE object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the Field: Template VAV System Name?
output: Enter the name of the HVACTemplate:System:VAV or HVACTemplate:System:PackagedVAV object serving this zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the Field: Template Thermostat Name?
output: Enter the name of a HVACTemplate:Thermostat object. Multiple HVACTemplate:Zone:* objects can reference the same HVACTemplate:Thermostat object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a blank entry mean in the Field: Template Thermostat Name?
output: A blank entry means that traditional thermostat objects referencing the same zone name are used instead of HVACTemplate:Thermostat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the significance of entering 'Autosize' in the Field: Primary Supply Air Maximum Flow Rate?
output: By entering Autosize the maximum primary supply air flow rate is automatically determined for the zone based on the loads experienced by the zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens to the air flow when the primary air flow reaches the minimum?
output: The fan switches on and secondary air is induced.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When does the heating coil switch on in a Parallel PIU Terminal Unit?
output: The heating coil will switch on as needed to meet any heating demand.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Where can more details be found about the AirTerminal:SingleDuct:ParallelPIU:Reheat?
output: Reference object AirTerminal:SingleDuct:ParallelPIU:Reheat for more details.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> figure in /UAStudy/EnergyPlus/doc/input-output-reference/media/
input: What does the figure labeled 'Parallel PIU Terminal Unit' depict?
output: The figure depicts a Parallel PIU Terminal Unit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the 'Field: Zone Name'?
output: Enter the name of the zone. The name must match a building zone name used in the ZONE object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the 'Field: Template VAV System Name'?
output: Enter the name of the HVACTemplate:System:VAV or HVACTemplate:System:PackagedVAV object serving this zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What object name should be entered in the 'Field: Template Thermostat Name'?
output: Enter the name of a HVACTemplate:Thermostat object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the special meaning of a blank entry in the 'Field: Template Thermostat Name'?
output: A blank entry means that traditional thermostat objects referencing the same zone name are used instead of HVACTemplate:Thermostat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens when 'Autosize' is entered for the 'Field: Primary Supply Air Maximum Flow Rate'?
output: The maximum primary supply air flow rate is automatically determined for the zone based on the loads experienced by the zone during the specified and cooling SizingPeriod:DesignDay.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What units are used for the 'Primary Supply Air Maximum Flow Rate'?
output: The units are in m3/s.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Field: Zone Heating Sizing Factor'?
output: This input is the zone level heating sizing ratio.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the 'Field: Zone Heating Sizing Factor' is left blank?
output: The Heating Sizing Factor from Sizing:Parameters will be used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Field: Zone Cooling Sizing Factor'?
output: This input is the zone level cooling sizing ratio.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the 'Field: Zone Cooling Sizing Factor' is left blank?
output: The Cooling Sizing Factor from Sizing:Parameters will be used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is entered in the 'Field: Primary Supply Air Minimum Flow Fraction'?
output: Enter the fraction that the VAV box can reduce to based on the primary supply air maximum flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if 'Autosize' is entered for the 'Field: Primary Supply Air Minimum Flow Fraction'?
output: This field may be sized automatically by entering Autosize.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Secondary Supply Air Maximum Flow Rate' refer to?
output: In a fan powered VAV terminal unit the secondary air flow is the air taken from the zone by the terminal unit fan.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if a value is entered for the maximum supply air flow rate into the zone?
output: If a value is entered it is used as the maximum supply air flow rate into the zone. It will be multiplied by the Supply Air Sizing Factor and by zone multipliers.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does the HVACTemplate:System:VAV or HVACTemplate:System:PackagedVAV object affect the specification of supply air flow?
output: The HVACTemplate:System:VAV or HVACTemplate:System:PackagedVAV object allows the specification of supply air flow. If the value is specified at the system level it will scale the zone values to match.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the units for the maximum supply air flow rate?
output: The units are in m3/s.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Field: Zone Heating Sizing Factor'?
output: This input is the zone level heating sizing ratio. The zone design heating air flow rate and load will be multiplied by the number input in this field when Primary Supply Air Maximum Flow Rate is autosized.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the 'Field: Zone Heating Sizing Factor' is left blank?
output: If this field is left blank the Heating Sizing Factor from Sizing:Parameters will be used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Field: Zone Cooling Sizing Factor'?
output: This input is the zone level cooling sizing ratio. The zone design cooling air flow rate and load will be multiplied by the number input in this field when Primary Supply Air Maximum Flow Rate is autosized.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the 'Field: Zone Cooling Sizing Factor' is left blank?
output: If this field is left blank the Cooling Sizing Factor from Sizing:Parameters will be used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Primary Supply Air Minimum Flow Fraction' specify?
output: Enter the fraction that the VAV box can reduce to based on the primary supply air maximum flow rate. This field may be sized automatically by entering Autosize.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the 'Field: Secondary Supply Air Maximum Flow Rate' used for?
output: In a fan powered VAV terminal unit the secondary air flow is the air taken from the zone by the terminal unit fan. By entering Autosize the maximum secondary supply air flow rate is automatically determined for the zone based on the loads experienced by the zone during the specified heating SizingPeriod:DesignDay.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if a value is entered for the 'Field: Secondary Supply Air Maximum Flow Rate'?
output: If a value is entered it will be multiplied by the Supply Air Sizing Factor and by zone multipliers. The units are in m3/s.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Flow Type' specify?
output: This field specifies the type of fan powered unit (PIU). The choices for this field are: Series Parallel SeriesFromPlenum ParallelFromPlenum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens for all types of fan powered units regarding the secondary fan?
output: For all types the secondary fan will run according to the Zone PIU Fan Schedule and any Night Cycle Control specified in the system which serves this terminal unit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What additional control is there for Parallel PIU?
output: For Parallel PIU there is an additional secondary fan control based on the primary air flow fraction.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must be specified for recirculation from plenum?
output: A Return Plenum Name must be specified in this object or in the system object which serves this terminal unit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default flow type?
output: The default is Parallel.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Parallel Fan On Flow Fraction' specify?
output: For parallel PIUs this field specifies the fraction of the primary air flow at which the fan turns on.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the primary air flow is above the specified fraction in a parallel PIU?
output: If the primary air flow is above this fraction of the maximum the fan is off.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the primary air flow is below the specified fraction in a parallel PIU?
output: Otherwise the secondary fan will run according to the System Availability Schedule and Night Cycle Control specified in the HVACTemplate:System:VAV or HVACTemplate:System:PackagedVAV.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if a value is entered for the zone based on the loads?
output: If a value is entered it will be multiplied by the Supply Air Sizing Factor and by zone multipliers.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the units for the specified value for zone loads?
output: The units are in m3/s.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Flow Type' specify?
output: This field specifies the type of fan powered unit (PIU).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices for the 'Field: Flow Type'?
output: The choices are: Series Parallel SeriesFromPlenum ParallelFromPlenum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Where can descriptions of the configurations for 'Field: Flow Type' be found?
output: Descriptions can be found in the general description for this object above.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does the secondary fan operate for all types of PIUs?
output: The secondary fan will run according to the Zone PIU Fan Schedule and any Night Cycle Control specified in the system which serves this terminal unit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What additional control is there for Parallel PIU?
output: There is an additional secondary fan control based on the primary air flow fraction.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must be specified for recirculation from plenum?
output: A Return Plenum Name must be specified in this object or in the system object that serves this terminal unit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default configuration for 'Field: Flow Type'?
output: The default is Parallel.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Parallel Fan On Flow Fraction' specify?
output: For parallel PIUs this field specifies the fraction of the primary air flow at which the fan turns on.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does the fan operate in a parallel PIU?
output: In the parallel PIU the fan operation is intermittent.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the fan off in a parallel PIU?
output: If the primary air flow is above this fraction of the maximum the fan is off.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When will the secondary fan run in a parallel PIU?
output: The secondary fan will run according to the System Availability Schedule and Night Cycle Control specified in the system which serves this terminal unit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Does the 'Field: Parallel Fan On Flow Fraction' apply to series PIUs?
output: No this field does not apply to series PIUs.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must the input be for the 'Field: Outdoor Air Method'?
output: The input must be either Flow/Zone Flow/Person Flow/Area Sum Maximum or DetailedSpecification.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'Flow/Zone' mean in the 'Field: Outdoor Air Method'?
output: It means the program will use the input of the field Outdoor Air Flow as the zone design outdoor air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the zone design outdoor air flow rate calculated for 'Flow/Person'?
output: The program will use the input from the field Outdoor Air Flow per Person and the maximum occupancy to calculate it.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'Flow/Area' mean in the 'Field: Outdoor Air Method'?
output: It means the program will use the input from the field Outdoor Air Flow per Zone Floor Area to calculate a zone design outdoor air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'Sum' mean in the 'Field: Outdoor Air Method'?
output: It means that the flows calculated from the fields Outdoor Air Flow per Person Outdoor Air Flow per Area and Outdoor Air Flow per Zone will be added to obtain the zone design outdoor air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'Maximum' mean in the 'Field: Outdoor Air Method'?
output: It means that the maximum flow derived from Outdoor Air Flow per Person Outdoor Air Flow per Area and Outdoor Air Flow per Zone will be used for the zone design outdoor air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default method for 'Field: Outdoor Air Method'?
output: The default is Flow/Person.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'DetailedSpecification' mean in the 'Field: Outdoor Air Method'?
output: It means that the outdoor air specifications will be taken from a DesignSpecification:OutdoorAir or DesignSpecification:OutdoorAir:SpaceList object and optional DesignSpecification:ZoneAirDistribution object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the air handler serves more than one zone?
output: The total outdoor air flow for the system is the sum of the zone outdoor air flows if the system outdoor air flow is autosized.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the role of HVACTemplate:System:PackagedVAV?
output: HVACTemplate:System:PackagedVAV serves this terminal unit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Does the field apply to series PIUs?
output: This field does not apply to series PIUs.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must the input be for the Field: Outdoor Air Method?
output: The input must be either Flow/Zone or Flow/Person Flow/Area Sum Maximum or DetailedSpecification.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does Flow/Zone mean?
output: Flow/Zone means that the program will use the input of the field Outdoor Air Flow as the zone design outdoor air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does Flow/Person mean?
output: Flow/Person means the program will use the input from the field Outdoor Air Flow per Person and the maximum occupancy to calculate a zone design outdoor air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does Flow/Area mean?
output: Flow/Area means the program will use the input from the field Outdoor Air Flow per Zone Floor Area to calculate a zone design outdoor air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does Sum mean in the context of outdoor air flow?
output: Sum means that the flows calculated from the fields Outdoor Air Flow per Person Outdoor Air Flow per Area and Outdoor Air Flow per Zone will be added to obtain the zone design outdoor air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does Maximum mean for outdoor air flow?
output: Maximum means that the maximum flow derived from Outdoor Air Flow per Person Outdoor Air Flow per Area and Outdoor Air Flow per Zone will be used for the zone design outdoor air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default method for outdoor air flow?
output: The default is Flow/Person.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does DetailedSpecification mean for outdoor air flow?
output: DetailedSpecification means that the outdoor air specifications will be taken from a DesignSpecification:OutdoorAir or DesignSpecification:OutdoorAir:SpaceList object and optional DesignSpecification:ZoneAirDistribution object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the air handler serves more than one zone?
output: If the air handler serves more than one zone the total outdoor air flow for the system is the sum of the zone outdoor air flows if the system outdoor air flow is autosized.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the amount of outdoor air delivered to the zone determined?
output: The amount of outdoor air actually delivered to the zone is based on the fraction of supply air delivered to the zone to the total supply air from the system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the design outdoor air flow rate per person?
output: The design outdoor air flow rate per person for this zone is 0.00944 cubic meters per second (20 cfm per person).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the outdoor air flow rate calculated for a zone?
output: An outdoor air flow rate is calculated based on the total number of people for all People statements assigned to the zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Are occupancy schedule values applied to the outdoor air flow rate calculation?
output: Occupancy schedule values are not applied.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the input for Outdoor Air Flow Rate per Person used?
output: This input is used if Outdoor Air Method is one of Outdoor Air Flow per Person Sum or Maximum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the design outdoor air volumetric flow rate per square meter of floor area?
output: The design outdoor air volumetric flow rate per square meter of floor area is in units of m³/s-m².

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the flow rate obtained using Outdoor Air Flow Rate per Zone Floor Area?
output: This input is multiplied by the zone area to obtain a flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the input for Outdoor Air Flow Rate per Zone Floor Area used?
output: This input is used if Outdoor Air Method is Flow/Area Sum or Maximum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the design outdoor air flow rate for a zone?
output: The design outdoor air flow rate for this zone is in cubic meters per second.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the input for Outdoor Air Flow Rate per Zone used?
output: This input field is used if Outdoor Air Method is Flow/Zone Sum or Maximum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What can be added to the VAV box with the Field: Reheat Coil Type?
output: A reheat coil may be added to the VAV box with this field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices for Reheat Coil Type?
output: The choices are: HotWater Electric Gas.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default choice for Reheat Coil Type?
output: The default choice is Electric.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should you do if you want the reheat coil to be available for the entire year?
output: Leave the Reheat Coil Availability Schedule Name field blank if you want the reheat coil to be available for the entire year.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does specifying a schedule name for the reheat coil do?
output: If a schedule name is specified those times that the coil is available should be specified as 1.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the amount of outdoor air delivered to the zone determined?
output: The amount of outdoor air actually delivered to the zone is based on the fraction of supply air delivered to the zone to the total supply air from the system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the design outdoor air flow rate per person for a zone?
output: The design outdoor air flow rate per person for this zone is in cubic meters per second with a default of 0.00944 (20 cfm per person).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the outdoor air flow rate calculated based on the number of people?
output: An outdoor air flow rate is calculated based on the total number of people for all People statements assigned to the zone without applying occupancy schedule values.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the design outdoor air flow rate per person used?
output: This input is used if Outdoor Air Method is one of Outdoor Air Flow per Person Sum or Maximum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the design outdoor air volumetric flow rate per square meter of floor area?
output: The design outdoor air volumetric flow rate per square meter of floor area is in m³/s-m².

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the flow rate obtained using the design outdoor air flow rate per zone floor area?
output: This input is multiplied by the zone area to obtain a flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the design outdoor air flow rate per zone floor area used?
output: This input is used if Outdoor Air Method is Flow/Area Sum or Maximum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the design outdoor air flow rate for a zone?
output: The design outdoor air flow rate for this zone is in cubic meters per second.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the design outdoor air flow rate per zone used?
output: This input field is used if Outdoor Air Method is Flow/Zone Sum or Maximum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What can be added to the VAV box using the 'Reheat Coil Type' field?
output: A reheat coil may be added to the VAV box with this field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices for the reheat coil type?
output: The choices are: HotWater Electric Gas.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default choice for the reheat coil type?
output: The default choice is Electric.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be done if the reheat coil is to be available for the entire year?
output: Leave the 'Reheat Coil Availability Schedule Name' field blank if you want the reheat coil to be available for the entire year.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should a schedule specify in the 'Reheat Coil Availability Schedule Name' field?
output: If a schedule name is specified those times that the coil is available should be specified as 1.0 and those times that the coil is not available should have a zero value.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Reheat Coil Availability Schedule Name' field schedule?
output: It is a schedule of when the coil can provide heat not when it is providing heat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Fan Total Efficiency' field represent?
output: It represents the total efficiency of the zone induction fan which is the ratio of the power delivered to the fluid to the electrical input power.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the total efficiency of the fan calculated?
output: It is the product of the motor efficiency and the impeller efficiency.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the motor efficiency?
output: The motor efficiency is the power delivered to the shaft divided by the electrical power input to the motor.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the impeller efficiency?
output: The impeller efficiency is the power delivered to the fluid (air) divided by the shaft power.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the power delivered to the fluid calculated?
output: It is calculated as the mass flow rate of the air multiplied by the pressure rise divided by the air density.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the required range for the 'Fan Total Efficiency' input value?
output: This input value must be between 0 and 1 with a default of 0.7.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Fan Delta Pressure' field specify?
output: It specifies the pressure rise of the zone induction fan in Pa at full flow and standard conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the standard conditions for 'Fan Delta Pressure'?
output: Standard conditions are considered 20°C at sea level 101325 Pa.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Fan Motor Efficiency' field indicate?
output: It indicates the shaft power of the zone induction fan divided by the electrical power consumed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the required range for the 'Fan Motor Efficiency' value?
output: It must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What assumption is made about the zone fan motor in the 'Fan Motor Efficiency' field?
output: The zone fan motor is assumed to be 100% in the air stream.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Supply Plenum Name' field allow the user to specify?
output: It allows the user to specify a supply plenum which serves only this zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Where is the plenum zone added in the supply air path?
output: The plenum zone is added to the supply air path after the system splitter or system-level supply plenum and before the zone terminal unit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be done if no supply plenum is to be modeled?
output: Set the 'Supply Plenum Name' field to blank if no supply plenum is to be modeled.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How must a supply plenum be modeled if it is included?
output: If a supply plenum is modeled it must be modeled as a zone with surfaces and the name of the plenum zone should be entered.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Return Plenum Name' field allow the user to specify?
output: This field allows the user to specify a return plenum which serves only this zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should the schedule value be when the coil is not providing heat?
output: The schedule should have a zero value when the coil is not providing heat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the schedule specify for the coil?
output: The schedule specifies when the coil can provide heat not when it is providing heat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Fan Total Efficiency' field?
output: The 'Fan Total Efficiency' field is for entering the total efficiency of the zone induction fan.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the total efficiency of the fan represent?
output: The total efficiency of the fan represents the ratio of the power delivered to the fluid to the electrical input power.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the total efficiency of the fan calculated?
output: The total efficiency of the fan is the product of the motor efficiency and the impeller efficiency.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is motor efficiency?
output: Motor efficiency is the power delivered to the shaft divided by the electrical power input to the motor.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is impeller efficiency?
output: Impeller efficiency is the power delivered to the fluid (air) divided by the shaft power.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the power delivered to the fluid calculated?
output: The power delivered to the fluid is calculated as the mass flow rate of the air multiplied by the pressure rise divided by the air density.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the valid range for the fan total efficiency input value?
output: The input value must be between 0 and 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the fan total efficiency?
output: The default value for the fan total efficiency is 0.7.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the 'Fan Delta Pressure' field used for?
output: The 'Fan Delta Pressure' field is used to enter the pressure rise of the zone induction fan in Pa at full flow and standard conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are considered standard conditions for the fan delta pressure?
output: Standard conditions are considered 20°C at sea level 101325 Pa.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the 'Fan Motor Efficiency' field used for?
output: The 'Fan Motor Efficiency' field is used to enter the shaft power of the zone induction fan divided by the electrical power consumed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the valid range for fan motor efficiency?
output: The fan motor efficiency must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What assumption is made about the zone fan motor?
output: The zone fan motor is assumed to be 100% in the air stream.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Supply Plenum Name' field allow the user to specify?
output: The 'Supply Plenum Name' field allows the user to specify a supply plenum which serves only this zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Where is the plenum zone added in the air path?
output: The plenum zone is added to the supply air path after the system splitter or system-level supply plenum and before the zone terminal unit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be done if no supply plenum is to be modeled?
output: Set the 'Supply Plenum Name' field to blank if no supply plenum is to be modeled.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must be done if a supply plenum is modeled?
output: If a supply plenum is modeled it must be modeled as a zone with surfaces and the name of the plenum zone should be entered in the 'Supply Plenum Name' field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Return Plenum Name' field allow the user to specify?
output: The 'Return Plenum Name' field allows the user to specify a return plenum which serves only this zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Where is the return plenum zone added in the air path?
output: The return plenum zone is added to the return air path immediately after the zone and before the system mixer or system-level return plenum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be done if no zone return plenum is to be modeled?
output: Set the 'Return Plenum Name' field to blank if no zone return plenum is to be modeled.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must be done if a zone return plenum is modeled?
output: If a zone return plenum is modeled it must be modeled as a zone with surfaces and the name of the plenum zone should be entered in the 'Return Plenum Name' field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Baseboard Heating Type' field specify?
output: The 'Baseboard Heating Type' field specifies the availability of thermostatically controlled baseboard heat in this zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices for baseboard heating type?
output: The choices are HotWater Electric and None.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default choice for baseboard heating type?
output: The default choice is None.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Baseboard Heating Availability Schedule Name' field specify?
output: The 'Baseboard Heating Availability Schedule Name' field specifies when the baseboard heating is available.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be done if baseboard heating is to be available for the entire year?
output: Leave the 'Baseboard Heating Availability Schedule Name' field blank if baseboard heating is to be available for the entire year.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should the schedule value be when baseboard heating is available?
output: The schedule value should be 1.0 when baseboard heating is available.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should the schedule value be when baseboard heating is not available?
output: The schedule value should have a zero value when baseboard heating is not available.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the schedule specify for the baseboard heating?
output: The schedule specifies when the baseboard heating can provide heat not when it is providing heat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Baseboard Heating Capacity' field specify?
output: The 'Baseboard Heating Capacity' field specifies the maximum amount of heat that the baseboard heating can deliver in Watts.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered to allow the sizing algorithm to determine the proper capacity for baseboard heating?
output: Enter 'autosize' to allow the sizing algorithm to determine the proper capacity.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does EnergyPlus autosizing do for baseboard heating?
output: EnergyPlus autosizing will autosize the baseboard heating to meet the full heating load of the zone regardless of the heating capability of the VAV air handling system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the heating priority for baseboard heating?
output: The baseboard heating will be set to heating priority 2.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does heating priority 2 mean for baseboard heating?
output: Heating priority 2 means it will meet any remaining heating load not met by the VAV system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What change occurred in version 7.1 regarding baseboard heating capacity?
output: Starting with version 7.1 the capacity will be used for both hot water and electric baseboard whereas prior to v7.1 the capacity was only applied to electric baseboard.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Where is the plenum zone added in the return air path?
output: The plenum zone is added to the return air path immediately after the zone and before the system mixer or system-level return plenum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be done if no zone return plenum is to be modeled?
output: Set to blank if no zone return plenum is to be modeled.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How should a modeled zone return plenum be entered?
output: If a zone return plenum is modeled it must be modeled as a zone with surfaces and the name of the plenum zone should be entered here.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the field 'Baseboard Heating Type' specify?
output: This field specifies the availability of thermostatically controlled baseboard heat in this zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices for baseboard heating type?
output: The choices are: HotWater Electric None.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default choice for baseboard heating type?
output: The default choice is None.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be done if you want baseboard heating available for the entire year?
output: Leave this field blank if you want the baseboard heating to be available for the entire year.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How should a schedule name be specified for baseboard heating availability?
output: If a schedule name is specified those times that the baseboard heating is available should be specified as 1.0. Those times that the baseboard heating is not available should have a zero value in the schedule.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the baseboard heating availability schedule indicate?
output: This is not a schedule of when the baseboard is providing heat but a schedule of when it can provide heat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does entering 'autosize' for baseboard heating capacity do?
output: Enter autosize to allow the sizing algorithm to determine the proper capacity required based on the loads experienced during the heating design day.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is specified if a value is given for baseboard heating capacity?
output: If a value is specified it is the maximum amount of heat that the baseboard heating can deliver in Watts.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does EnergyPlus autosizing handle baseboard heating?
output: EnergyPlus autosizing will autosize the baseboard heating to meet the full heating load of the zone regardless of the heating capability of the VAV air handling system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What priority is baseboard heating set to?
output: The baseboard heating will be set to heating priority 2 which means it will meet any remaining heating load not met by the VAV system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What change occurred in v7.1 regarding baseboard heating capacity?
output: Prior to v7.1 the capacity was only applied to electric baseboard. Starting with v7.1 the capacity will be used for both hot water and electric baseboard.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the field 'Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method' select?
output: This field selects the method for specifying the cooling design supply air temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'SupplyAirTemperature' mean in the context of Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method?
output: 'SupplyAirTemperature' means that the field Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature will be used for sizing the zone cooling design air flow rate and the cooling coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'TemperatureDifference' mean in the context of Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method?
output: 'TemperatureDifference' means that the field Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Difference will be used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'SystemSupplyAirTemperature' mean in the context of Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method?
output: 'SystemSupplyAirTemperature' means that the Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature from the template VAV system serving this zone will be used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default for Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method?
output: The default is 'SystemSupplyAirTemperature.'

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the supply air temperature used for in Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature?
output: The supply air temperature in degrees Celsius for the zone cooling design air flow rate calculation and cooling coil sizing.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the field Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature used?
output: This field is used only when Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method is 'SupplyAirTemperature.'

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default supply air temperature for Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature?
output: The default is 12.8°C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Difference represent?
output: The temperature difference between the cooling design supply air temperature and the zone air temperature in degrees Celsius for the zone cooling design air flow rate calculation and cooling coil sizing.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the sign of the temperature difference handled in Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Difference?
output: The absolute value is used so the sign may be positive or negative.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Difference field used?
output: This field is used only when Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method is 'TemperatureDifference.'

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Difference?
output: The default is 11.11 deltaC.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the field 'Zone Heating Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method' select?
output: This field selects the method for specifying the heating design supply air temperature.

output: The default is 'SystemSupplyAirTemperature'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Zone PIU Fan Schedule Name' field?
output: This is the operating schedule for the zone PIU fan.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When does the zone fan operate for a parallel PIU?
output: For a parallel PIU the zone fan operates only when the primary air flow is below the Parallel Fan On Flow Fraction and the Zone PIU Fan Schedule is on or when it is activated by an availability manager.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When does the zone fan operate for a series PIU?
output: For a series PIU the zone fan operates whenever the Zone PIU Fan Schedule is on or it is activated by an availability manager.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the 'Zone PIU Fan Schedule Name' field is left blank?
output: If this field is left blank the System Availability Schedule for the HVACTemplate:System serving this zone will be used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Design Specification Outdoor Air Object Name' field specify?
output: This alpha field specifies the name of a Design Specification Outdoor Air Object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Field: Design Specification Outdoor Air Object Name specify?
output: This alpha field specifies the name of a DesignSpecification:OutdoorAir or DesignSpecification:OutdoorAir:SpaceList object which specifies the design outdoor air flow rate for the zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Under what condition is the Field: Design Specification Outdoor Air Object Name used?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

input: Under what condition is the Field: Design Specification Zone Air Distribution Object Name used?
