instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the field 'Baseboard Heating Type' specify?
output: This field specifies the availability of thermostatically controlled baseboard heat in this zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices for baseboard heating type?
output: The choices are: HotWater Electric None.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default choice for baseboard heating type?
output: The default choice is None.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be done if baseboard heating is to be available for the entire year?
output: Leave this field blank if you want the baseboard heating to be available for the entire year to perform heating if called for by the thermostat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How should the schedule be specified if a schedule name is provided for baseboard heating availability?
output: If a schedule name is specified those times that the baseboard heating is available should be specified as 1.0. Those times that the baseboard heating is not available should have a zero value in the schedule.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the baseboard heating availability schedule specify?
output: This is not a schedule of when the baseboard is providing heat but a schedule of when it can provide heat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the field for baseboard heating capacity if autosizing is desired?
output: Enter autosize to allow the sizing algorithm to determine the proper capacity required based on the loads experienced during the heating design day.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does specifying a value for baseboard heating capacity represent?
output: If a value is specified it is the maximum amount of heat that the baseboard heating can deliver in Watts.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does EnergyPlus autosizing handle baseboard heating?
output: EnergyPlus autosizing will autosize the baseboard heating to meet the full heating load of the zone regardless of the heating capability of the VAV air handling system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the heating priority for baseboard heating?
output: The baseboard heating will be set to heating priority 2 which means it will meet any remaining heating load not met by the VAV system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How did the application of baseboard heating capacity change starting with v7.1?
output: Prior to v7.1 the capacity was only applied to electric baseboard. Starting with v7.1 the capacity will be used for both hot water and electric baseboard.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the field 'Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method' select?
output: This field selects the method for specifying the cooling design supply air temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'SupplyAirTemperature' mean in the context of cooling design?
output: SupplyAirTemperature means that the field Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature will be used for sizing the zone cooling design air flow rate and the cooling coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'TemperatureDifference' indicate in the cooling design method?
output: TemperatureDifference means that the field Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Difference will be used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'SystemSupplyAirTemperature' imply for cooling design?
output: SystemSupplyAirTemperature means that the Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature from the template system serving this zone will be used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default method for Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature?
output: The default is SystemSupplyAirTemperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the field 'Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature' specify?
output: The supply air temperature in degrees Celsius for the zone cooling design air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should the schedule contain when the baseboard heating is not available?
output: Those times that the baseboard heating is not available should have a zero value in the schedule.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the schedule for baseboard heating indicate?
output: This is not a schedule of when the baseboard is providing heat but a schedule of when it can provide heat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should you enter to allow the sizing algorithm to determine the proper capacity required for baseboard heating?
output: Enter autosize to allow the sizing algorithm to determine the proper capacity required based on the loads experienced during the heating design day.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a specified value for baseboard heating capacity represent?
output: If a value is specified it is the maximum amount of heat that the baseboard heating can deliver in Watts.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does EnergyPlus autosizing handle baseboard heating?
output: EnergyPlus autosizing will autosize the baseboard heating to meet the full heating load of the zone regardless of the heating capability of the VAV air handling system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What priority is set for baseboard heating and what does it mean?
output: The baseboard heating will be set to heating priority 2 which means it will meet any remaining heating load not met by the VAV system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How was baseboard heating capacity applied prior to v7.1 and how is it applied starting with v7.1?
output: Prior to v7.1 the capacity was only applied to electric baseboard. Starting with v7.1 the capacity will be used for both hot water and electric baseboard.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the field 'Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method' select?
output: This field selects the method for specifying the cooling design supply air temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'SupplyAirTemperature' mean in the context of cooling design supply air temperature input method?
output: 'SupplyAirTemperature' means that the field Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature will be used for sizing the zone cooling design air flow rate and the cooling coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'TemperatureDifference' mean in the context of cooling design supply air temperature input method?
output: 'TemperatureDifference' means that the field Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Difference will be used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'SystemSupplyAirTemperature' mean in the context of cooling design supply air temperature input method?
output: 'SystemSupplyAirTemperature' means that the Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature from the template system serving this zone will be used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default method for specifying the cooling design supply air temperature?
output: The default is 'SystemSupplyAirTemperature.'

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the field 'Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature'?
output: The supply air temperature in degrees Celsius for the zone cooling design air flow rate calculation and cooling coil sizing.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the field 'Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature' used?
output: This field is used only when Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method is 'SupplyAirTemperature.'

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the zone cooling design supply air temperature?
output: The default is 12.8°C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the field 'Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Difference' represent?
output: The temperature difference between the cooling design supply air temperature and the zone air temperature in degrees Celsius for the zone cooling design air flow rate calculation and cooling coil sizing.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Is the sign of the temperature difference in 'Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Difference' significant?
output: The absolute value is used so the sign may be positive or negative.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the field 'Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Difference' used?
output: This field is used only when Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method is 'TemperatureDifference.'

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the zone cooling design supply air temperature difference?
output: The default is 11.11 deltaC.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the field 'Zone Heating Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method' select?
output: This field selects the method for specifying the heating design supply air temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'SupplyAirTemperature' mean in the context of heating design supply air temperature input method?
output: 'SupplyAirTemperature' means that the field Zone Heating Design Supply Air Temperature will be used for sizing the zone heating design air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'TemperatureDifference' mean in the context of heating design supply air temperature input method?
output: 'TemperatureDifference' means that the field Zone Heating Design Supply Air Temperature Difference will be used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'SystemSupplyAirTemperature' mean in the context of heating design supply air temperature input method?
output: 'SystemSupplyAirTemperature' means that the Heating Coil Design Setpoint Temperature from the template system serving this zone will be used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default method for specifying the heating design supply air temperature?
output: The default is 'SystemSupplyAirTemperature.'

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the field 'Zone Heating Design Supply Air Temperature'?
output: The supply air temperature in degrees Celsius for the zone heating design air flow rate calculation and heating coil sizing.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the field 'Zone Heating Design Supply Air Temperature' used?
output: This field is used only when Zone Heating Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method is 'SupplyAirTemperature.'

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the zone heating design supply air temperature?
output: The default is 50°C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the air temperature in degrees Celsius for the zone cooling design air flow rate calculation and cooling coil sizing?
output: The air temperature is used only when Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method is SupplyAirTemperature with a default of 12.8°C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Difference?
output: It is the temperature difference between the cooling design supply air temperature and the zone air temperature in degrees Celsius. The absolute value is used and it is used only when Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method is TemperatureDifference with a default of 11.11 deltaC.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Zone Heating Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method field select?
output: This field selects the method for specifying the heating design supply air temperature with options including SupplyAirTemperature TemperatureDifference and SystemSupplyAirTemperature. The default is SystemSupplyAirTemperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the Zone Heating Design Supply Air Temperature used for?
output: It is the supply air temperature in degrees Celsius for the zone heating design air flow rate calculation and heating coil sizing used only when Zone Heating Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method is SupplyAirTemperature with a default of 50°C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the Zone Heating Design Supply Air Temperature Difference?
output: It is the temperature difference between heating design supply air temperature and zone air temperature in degrees Celsius used only when Zone Heating Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method is TemperatureDifference with a default of 30 deltaC.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> listing
input: What is an example of an IDF for HVACTemplate:Zone:DualDuct?
output: An example is: HVACTemplate:Zone:DualDuct SPACE1-1 DD Sys 1 All Zones autosize   0.2 flow/person 0.00944 0.0 0.0     None  autosize; SystemSupplyAirTemperature 12.8 11.11 SystemSupplyAirTemperature 50 30;

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the temperature difference used for in the zone heating design air flow rate calculation?
output: The temperature difference between heating design supply air temperature and zone air temperature in degrees Celsius is used for the zone heating design air flow rate calculation and heating coil sizing.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Is the sign of the temperature difference significant in the calculation?
output: The absolute value is used so the sign may be positive or negative.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the temperature difference field used?
output: This field is used only when Zone Heating Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method is TemperatureDifference.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default temperature difference for the zone heating design supply air temperature?
output: The default is 30 deltaC.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> listing
input: What is an example of an IDF for a dual duct system?
output: An example is provided in the listing: HVACTemplate:Zone:DualDuct SPACE1-1 DD Sys 1 All Zones autosize etc.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the HVACTemplate:System:VRF model simulate?
output: This model simulates a variable-refrigerant-flow (or variable-refrigerant-volume) air-conditioning system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What system type does the HVACTemplate:System:VRF model?
output: This system type models direct-expansion cooling and/or heating coils configured in a zone terminal unit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Where can more details about the VRF system type be found?
output: More details can be found in AirConditioner:VariableRefrigerantFlow.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the 'Field: Name' for the HVACTemplate:System:VRF object?
output: Enter a name for the HVACTemplate:System:VRF object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Field: System Availability Schedule Name' define?
output: This alpha field defines the name of the schedule that denotes whether the heat pump operates during a given time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a schedule value of 0 indicate in the system availability schedule?
output: A schedule value equal to 0 denotes that the heat pump must be off for that time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the 'System Availability Schedule Name' field is left blank?
output: If this field is blank the unit is enabled the entire simulation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Gross Rated Total Cooling Capacity' define?
output: This numeric field defines the gross rated total cooling capacity of the DX cooling coil in watts.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should the total cooling capacity be considered as?
output: The total cooling capacity should be a 'gross' i.e. the effect of supply air fan heat NOT accounted for.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Gross Rated Cooling COP' define?
output: This numeric field defines the cooling coefficient of performance at rated conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the cooling coefficient of performance include?
output: The cooling coefficient of performance includes compressor power and condenser fan power.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the HVACTemplate:System:VRF model simulate?
output: This model simulates a variable-refrigerant-flow (or variable-refrigerant-volume) air-conditioning system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What system type does the HVACTemplate:System:VRF model?
output: This system type models direct-expansion cooling and/or heating coils configured in a zone terminal unit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Where can more details about the HVACTemplate:System:VRF system type be found?
output: For more details about this system type see AirConditioner:VariableRefrigerantFlow.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the Field: Name for the HVACTemplate:System:VRF object?
output: Enter a name for the HVACTemplate:System:VRF object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the name used in the HVACTemplate:System:VRF object?
output: This name is used in the HVACTemplate:Zone:VRF object to reference this system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Field: System Availability Schedule Name define?
output: This alpha field defines the name of the schedule that denotes whether the heat pump operates during a given time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a schedule value of 0 indicate for the heat pump?
output: A schedule value equal to 0 denotes that the heat pump must be off for that time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a non-zero schedule value indicate for the heat pump?
output: A value other than 0 denotes that the heat pump is available to operate during that time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the Field: System Availability Schedule Name is left blank?
output: If this field is blank the unit is enabled the entire simulation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Field: Gross Rated Total Cooling Capacity define?
output: This numeric field defines the gross rated total cooling capacity of the DX cooling coil in watts.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should the total cooling capacity be considered as?
output: The total cooling capacity should be a 'gross' i.e. the effect of supply air fan heat NOT accounted for.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Field: Gross Rated Cooling COP define?
output: This numeric field defines the cooling coefficient of performance at rated conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the cooling coefficient of performance include?
output: The cooling coefficient of performance includes compressor power and condenser fan power.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default COP value if the Field: Gross Rated Cooling COP is left blank?
output: If this field is left blank a default coefficient of performance of 3.3 is assumed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Field: Minimum Outdoor Temperature in Cooling Mode define?
output: This numeric field defines the minimum outdoor dry-bulb temperature allowed for cooling operation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value if the Field: Minimum Outdoor Temperature in Cooling Mode is left blank?
output: If this field is left blank the default value is -6ºC.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Field: Maximum Outdoor Temperature in Cooling Mode define?
output: This numeric field defines the maximum outdoor dry-bulb temperature allowed for cooling operation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value if the Field: Maximum Outdoor Temperature in Cooling Mode is left blank?
output: If this field is left blank the default value is 43ºC.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Field: Gross Rated Heating Capacity define?
output: This numeric field defines the gross total heat pump heating capacity at rated conditions in watts.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must the nominal heat pump heating capacity be greater than?
output: The nominal heat pump heating capacity must be greater than 0 or set to autosize.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Field: Rated Heating Capacity Sizing Ratio define?
output: This numeric field defines the ratio of gross heating to gross cooling capacity.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What assumption is made about the Field: Rated Heating Capacity Sizing Ratio?
output: The model assumes that when used this value will be greater than 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens when the heating capacity is autosized and the Field: Rated Heating Capacity Sizing Ratio is non-blank?
output: When the heating capacity is autosized if this field is non-blank this ratio is used to scale the heating capacity to the gross rated total cooling capacity regardless of the value entered in the terminal unit objects.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens when the heating capacity is not autosized?
output: When the heating capacity is not autosized the gross rated heating capacity will be equal to the sum of the terminal unit heating coil size.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is assumed if both the Field: Rated Heating Capacity Sizing Ratio and terminal unit sizing ratio input are blank?
output: If this field is blank and the terminal unit sizing ratio input is also blank then the heating capacity sizing ratio is assumed to be 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is assumed if the field for coefficient of performance is left blank?
output: A default coefficient of performance of 3.3 is assumed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

output: The supply air fan is not accounted for in the gross COP value.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

output: The nominal heat pump heating COP must be greater than 0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

output: This numeric field defines the maximum outdoor temperature allowed for heating operation. Above this temperature heating is disabled.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Minimum Heat Pump Part-Load Ratio field specify?
output: This numeric field specifies the minimum operating part-load ratio (PLR) of the heat pump.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens when the heat pump operates at a PLR below the minimum value?
output: The heat pump's compressor will cycle to meet the cooling or heating demand.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens when the heat pump operates at a PLR above the minimum value?
output: The heat pump's compressor operates the entire time step to meet the cooling or heating demand.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the minimum value for the Minimum Heat Pump Part-Load Ratio field?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value if the Minimum Heat Pump Part-Load Ratio field is left blank?
output: The default value is 0.15.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is used to determine cycling losses when the heat pump compressor cycles?
output: The previous field is used to determine cycling losses.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the heating capacity sizing ratio in the terminal units is not blank?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

output: This numeric field defines the heating coefficient of performance at rated conditions including compressor power and condenser fan power but not supply air fan.

input: What does the maximum outdoor temperature in heating mode field define?
output: This numeric field defines the maximum outdoor temperature allowed for heating operation above which heating is disabled.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default maximum outdoor temperature for heating operation if the field is left blank?
output: 16ºC.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the minimum heat pump part-load ratio field specify?
output: This numeric field specifies the minimum operating part-load ratio (PLR) of the heat pump.

input: What is the default minimum heat pump part-load ratio if the field is left blank?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the zone name for master thermostat location field define?
output: This alpha field defines the name of the zone where the master thermostat is located.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the master thermostat priority control type field determine?
output: This choice field determines the logic used to simulate the master thermostat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the master thermostat priority control type?
output: MasterThermostatPriority.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the thermostat priority schedule name field identify?
output: This alpha field identifies the schedule used when the master thermostat priority control type is set to Scheduled.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What do schedule values of 0 and 1 denote in the thermostat priority schedule?
output: Schedule values of 0 denote cooling mode while values of 1 denote heating mode.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the heat pump waste heat recovery field define?
output: This choice field defines the configuration of the heat pump refrigeration system with choices of Yes or No.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if 'Yes' is selected for the heat pump waste heat recovery field?
output: Heat recovery is enabled allowing the heat pump to independently cool and heat different zones.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the field define in terms of the master thermostat's location?
output: The field defines the name of the zone where the master thermostat is located. When the heat pump is connected to multiple zone terminal units one terminal unit must be selected as the master thermostat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the role of the remaining thermostats when a master thermostat is selected?
output: The remaining thermostats are slaves and can operate only in the same mode as the master thermostat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Master Thermostat Priority Control Type' determine?
output: This choice field determines the logic used to simulate the master thermostat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the valid choices for the 'Master Thermostat Priority Control Type' field?
output: Valid choices are LoadPriority ZonePriority ThermostatOffsetPriority MasterThermostatPriority and Scheduled.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the 'Master Thermostat Priority Control Type' field?
output: The default value is MasterThermostatPriority.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens when 'LoadPriority' is selected for the master thermostat priority control type?
output: When LoadPriority is selected the total zone load is used to choose the operating mode as either cooling or heating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does the 'ZonePriority' choice affect the operating mode?
output: When ZonePriority is selected the number of zones requiring cooling or heating determines the operating mode.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'ThermostatOffsetPriority' choice determine?
output: When ThermostatOffsetPriority is selected the zone farthest from the thermostat set point determines the operating mode.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does the 'MasterThermostatPriority' choice operate the system?
output: The MasterThermostatPriority choice operates the system according to the zone load where the master thermostat is located.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How can the heat pump be scheduled to operate?
output: The heat pump can be scheduled to operate in either cooling or heating mode. For scheduled operation a schedule name is entered in the following field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Thermostat Priority Schedule Name' identify?
output: This alpha field identifies the schedule used when the previous field is set to Scheduled.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What do schedule values of 0 and 1 denote in the 'Thermostat Priority Schedule Name' field?
output: Schedule values of 0 denote cooling mode while values of 1 denote heating mode.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if any other values apart from 0 and 1 are used in the schedule?
output: Any other values will force the system off.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Heat Pump Waste Heat Recovery' define?
output: This choice field defines the configuration of the heat pump refrigeration system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the valid choices for the 'Heat Pump Waste Heat Recovery' field?
output: Valid choices are Yes and No.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if 'Yes' is selected for the 'Heat Pump Waste Heat Recovery' field?
output: If Yes is selected heat recovery is enabled and the heat pump can independently cool and heat different zones.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the limitation if 'No' is selected for the 'Heat Pump Waste Heat Recovery' field?
output: If No is selected the heat pump is only able to cool or heat for any given time step.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Equivalent Piping Length used for Piping Correction Factor in Cooling Mode' define?
output: This numeric field defines the equivalent pipe length in meters between the farthest terminal unit and the heat pump condenser.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the equivalent piping length include?
output: This value includes the gas refrigerant line length (for both horizontal and vertical distances) fitting losses pipe bends and other connections that contribute to piping losses.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the equivalent piping length in cooling mode?
output: This field is used to calculate the piping correction factor in cooling mode.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does the equivalent piping length impact cooling mode?
output: This value defines the head losses due to the pipe length between the farthest terminal unit and the heat pump condenser and impacts the maximum available capacity in cooling mode.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Vertical Height used for Piping Correction Factor' define?
output: This numeric field defines the vertical pipe height in meters between the highest or lowest terminal unit and the heat pump condenser.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the vertical height value define?
output: This value defines the gravitational losses due to a change in height between the highest (positive value) or lowest (negative value) terminal unit and the heat pump condenser.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the distance specified in the vertical height field applied?
output: The distance specified here is applied to the piping correction factor calculation for both cooling and heating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How should the distance be entered if the highest terminal unit is above the heat pump condenser?
output: If the distance between the highest terminal unit above the heat pump condenser is greater than the distance between the lowest terminal unit below the condenser enter the difference between the highest and lowest terminal units as a positive distance.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How should the distance be entered if the lowest terminal unit is below the heat pump condenser?
output: If the distance between the highest terminal unit above the heat pump condenser is not greater than the distance between the lowest terminal unit below the condenser enter this difference as a negative distance.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Provide an example of how to enter the vertical height value.
output: Example: if the distance from the heat pump condenser to the highest terminal unit above the condenser is 10 m and the distance from the heat pump condenser to the lowest terminal unit below the condenser is -15 m then enter a value of -5 m in this field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does the head loss impact the system in cooling mode?
output: This head loss impacts the maximum available capacity in cooling mode.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the numeric field 'Equivalent Piping Length used for Piping Correction Factor in Cooling Mode' define?
output: This numeric field defines the equivalent pipe length in meters between the farthest terminal unit and the heat pump condenser.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the equivalent pipe length include?
output: This value includes the gas refrigerant line length (for both horizontal and vertical distances) fitting losses pipe bends and other connections that contribute to piping losses.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the equivalent pipe length in cooling mode?
output: This field is used to calculate the piping correction factor in cooling mode.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does the equivalent pipe length impact the cooling mode?
output: This value defines the head losses due to the pipe length between the farthest terminal unit and the heat pump condenser and impacts the maximum available capacity in cooling mode.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the numeric field 'Vertical Height used for Piping Correction Factor' define?
output: This numeric field defines the vertical pipe height in meters between the highest or lowest terminal unit and the heat pump condenser.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the vertical pipe height value define?
output: This value defines the gravitational losses due to a change in height between the highest (positive value) or lowest (negative value) terminal unit and the heat pump condenser.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: For what calculations is the vertical pipe height distance applied?
output: The distance specified here is applied to the piping correction factor calculation for both cooling and heating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How should the vertical height be entered if the highest terminal unit above the heat pump condenser is greater than the lowest terminal unit below?
output: Enter the difference between the highest and lowest terminal units as a positive distance.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Provide an example of how to enter the vertical height value.
output: Example: if the distance from the heat pump condenser to the highest terminal unit above the condenser is 10 m and the distance to the lowest terminal unit below the condenser is -15 m enter a value of -5 m.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does the vertical height impact the cooling mode?
output: This head loss impacts the maximum available capacity in cooling mode.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the numeric field 'Equivalent Piping Length used for Piping Correction Factor in Heating Mode' define?
output: This numeric field defines the equivalent pipe length in meters between the farthest terminal unit and the heat pump condenser.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the equivalent pipe length include in heating mode?
output: This value includes the liquid refrigerant line length (for both horizontal and vertical distances) fitting losses pipe bends and other connections that contribute to piping losses.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the equivalent pipe length in heating mode?
output: This field is used to calculate the piping correction factor in heating mode.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does the equivalent pipe length impact the heating mode?
output: This value defines the head losses due to the pipe length between the farthest terminal unit and the heat pump condenser and impacts the maximum available capacity in heating mode.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the numeric field 'Crankcase Heater Power per Compressor' define?
output: This numeric field defines the electrical power consumed by the crankcase heater in watts for each compressor.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is crankcase heater power consumed?
output: This crankcase heater power is consumed when the outdoor temperature is below the maximum outdoor dry-bulb temperature for crankcase heater operation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the minimum value for the crankcase heater power per compressor field?
output: The minimum value for this field is 0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the crankcase heater power per compressor if left blank?
output: The default value is 33 watts.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is crankcase heater electrical consumption applied?
output: Crankcase heater electrical consumption is applied only when the compressor is off or is applied during the off cycle when the compressor is cycling below the Minimum Heat Pump Part-Load Ratio.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Does the crankcase heater power impact heat pump performance?
output: This field is only used to calculate crankcase heater power and has no impact on heat pump performance.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the numeric field 'Number of Compressors' define?
output: This numeric field defines the number of compressors in the heat pump condensing unit and is used exclusively to determine the operating characteristics of the crankcase heater.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Provide an example of how the number of compressors affects crankcase heater operation.
output: For example if the number of compressors is 3 one crankcase heater will operate when the heat pump condensing unit's part-load ratio is less than or equal to 0.67 (when the ratio of compressor size to total compressor capacity input is 0.33) and the outdoor temperature is below the maximum outdoor temperature for crankcase heater operation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the numeric field define in relation to the pipe length?
output: This numeric field defines the equivalent pipe length in meters between the farthest terminal unit and the heat pump condenser.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the pipe length value include?
output: This value includes the liquid refrigerant line length (for both horizontal and vertical distances) fitting losses pipe bends and other connections that contribute to piping losses.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is this field used for in heating mode?
output: This field is used to calculate the piping correction factor in heating mode.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does this value define regarding head losses?
output: This value defines the head losses due to the pipe length between the farthest terminal unit and the heat pump condenser and impacts the maximum available capacity in heating mode.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the numeric field 'Crankcase Heater Power per Compressor' define?
output: This numeric field defines the electrical power consumed by the crankcase heater in watts for each compressor.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the crankcase heater power consumed?
output: This crankcase heater power is consumed when the outdoor temperature is below the maximum outdoor dry-bulb temperature for crankcase heater operation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the minimum value for the crankcase heater power field?
output: The minimum value for this field is 0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value if the crankcase heater power field is left blank?
output: If this field is left blank the default value is 33 watts.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is crankcase heater electrical consumption applied?
output: Crankcase heater electrical consumption is applied only when the compressor is off or is applied during the off cycle when the compressor is cycling below the Minimum Heat Pump Part-Load Ratio.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Does the crankcase heater power field impact heat pump performance?
output: This field is only used to calculate crankcase heater power and has no impact on heat pump performance.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the numeric field 'Number of Compressors' define?
output: This numeric field defines the number of compressors in the heat pump condensing unit and is used exclusively to determine the operating characteristics of the crankcase heater.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens when the number of compressors is 3 and the PLR is less than or equal to 0.67?
output: One crankcase heater will operate when the heat pump condensing unit's part-load ratio is less than or equal to 0.67 and the outdoor temperature is below the maximum outdoor temperature for crankcase heater operation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens when the number of compressors is 3 and the PLR is less than or equal to 0.33?
output: Two crankcase heaters will operate when the heat pump condensing unit's PLR is less than or equal to 0.33 and the outdoor temperature is below the maximum outdoor temperature for crankcase heater operation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens when the heat pump condensing unit is off?
output: If the heat pump condensing unit is off all 3 crankcase heaters will operate if the outdoor temperature is below the maximum outdoor temperature for crankcase heater operation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the minimum value for the number of compressors field?
output: The minimum value for this field is 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value if the number of compressors field is left blank?
output: If this field is left blank the default value is 2.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Does the number of compressors field impact heat pump performance?
output: This field is only used to calculate crankcase heater power and has no impact on heat pump performance.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the numeric field 'Ratio of Compressor Size to Total Compressor Capacity' define?
output: This numeric field defines the size of the first stage compressor to the total compressor capacity and is used exclusively for calculating crankcase heater energy.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value if the ratio of compressor size to total compressor capacity field is left blank?
output: If this field and the previous field are left blank the default value is 0.5.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What assumption is made if the ratio of compressor size to total compressor capacity field is left blank and the previous field is not blank?
output: If this field is left blank and the previous field is not blank the compressors are assumed to be equally sized.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What assumption is made when the number of compressors is greater than 2?
output: When the number of compressors is greater than 2 the 2nd stage compressor and all additional compressors are assumed to be equally sized.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Does the ratio of compressor size to total compressor capacity field impact heat pump performance?
output: This field is only used to calculate crankcase heater power and has no impact on heat pump performance.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the numeric field 'Maximum Outdoor Dry-bulb Temperature for Crankcase Heater' define?
output: This numeric field defines the maximum outdoor temperature in degrees Celsius below which the crankcase heater will operate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value if the maximum outdoor dry-bulb temperature for crankcase heater field is left blank?
output: If this field is left blank the default value is 0°C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Does the maximum outdoor dry-bulb temperature for crankcase heater field impact heat pump performance?
output: This field is only used to calculate crankcase heater power and has no impact on heat pump performance.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What choices are available for the defrost strategy field?
output: This alpha field has two choices: reverse-cycle or resistive.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the reverse-cycle strategy is selected for defrosting?
output: If the reverse-cycle strategy is selected the heating cycle is reversed periodically to provide heat to melt frost accumulated on the outdoor coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if a resistive defrost strategy is selected?
output: If a resistive defrost strategy is selected the frost is melted using an electric resistance.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Under what conditions will all three crankcase heaters operate if the heat pump condensing unit is off?
output: All three crankcase heaters will operate if the outdoor temperature is below the maximum outdoor temperature for crankcase heater operation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the minimum value for the field related to crankcase heater operation?
output: The minimum value for this field is 1.

output: If this field is left blank the default value is 2.

output: This numeric field defines the size of the first stage compressor to the total compressor capacity and is used exclusively for calculating crankcase heater energy.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Maximum Outdoor Dry-bulb Temperature for Crankcase Heater' field?
output: This numeric field defines the maximum outdoor temperature in degrees Celsius below which the crankcase heater will operate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the 'Maximum Outdoor Dry-bulb Temperature for Crankcase Heater' field if left blank?
